name: Richard Foster
text:
Sorry, this is a rather long comment. First, on a positive note. The store looks great and it's great to have a good hardware store so close. Also, the personnel were knowledgeable which usually is why I prefer stores like this over Big box retailers.

So I've had a day to consider my experience at this store. I was excited to have a reason to go to the new Ace store not too far from me. It didn't go well. And for perspective, I almost never strongly complain. But, to start, I'm exceptionally busy and need a place that is easy for transactions and returns. So, being busy, I went to the shed and found out I didn't have the key for the pad lock. I ran to Ace and picked up a small bolt cutter. Coming home, I tried twice on the lock and realized it was too small.

Returning to the store, I tried to return the item within 30 minutes of purchase (with receipt) to buy a large Bolt cutter. This is when I found out about the 'no return' for used items policy. OK, I can accept that. I won't be able to shop there. But I accept that. The problem? From my perspective, the owner was rude. 'No, we won't take that back. It's used' he said. IMO, 'I'm sorry, we're an independent franchise and we can't afford to take back used items' would have been a much better response.

One other story. Last year, I bought a push mower at Lowes. I tried it and it wasn't sufficient. I took it back and got a more powerful mower. They took it back no questions asked. Had I bought it at this Ace? Nope, no returns on used items. I could be wrong but I also assume you can't  bring back defectives items (it's under warranty so deal with the manufacturer?) I could be wrong there. But again, with all that's on my plate, I need easy returns. With all that said, I wish this store well. We need you here.

name: Debbie Reeves
text: As of this writing (late August 2021), the store is a brand new store. They just opened a few weeks ago. Being a new store, everything is squeaky clean and everything is on place. The ladies there were super nice and helpful. I would go back again because they are convenient to go to and have good selections of hardware.

name: Allison McCormick
text: So happy to have this new location open so close to home. The store was very clean and the associates were very helpful.

name: James White
text: So nice to have a hardware store here in the Harvest and Tony area. The store is stock full of essential and the staff's are super friendly.

name: Maryann Hockman
text:
Glad to give 5 stars. Will return for more shopping in the future.
Manager helped me with three items and my son with 2. Very willing to help and answer questions for us as we went along.
Sale just under $50.00, Very nice to have the story in our Toney, Alabama area.
Thank you!
MaryAnn

text: We use PPG paints exclusively for our home and for our barn quilt painting projects.  The employees at this store go over the top to be most helpful and friendly. When we had our home painted, we provided the paint for the guys.  When they saw we had purchased PPG they were so happy.  They told us that the PPG paint would hold up much longer than any other paint and would take fewer coats.  They were right.  We are lifelong customers for our personal use and for the Alabama Barn Quilt Trail.

UPDATE 30 April 17, Still poor customer service and they're still out of the parts we need. Made a dozen trips or more to Lowe's in the last month because they are always out. Really poor excuse for a business!!!!!!!! ABSOLUTE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!!!! WAITED OVER 30 MINUTES FOR HELP. I ASKED A GENTLEMAN TO SEND HELP AND THE CASHIER PAGED TWICE FOR SOMEONE TO COME HELP US. NO ONE EVER CAME. WAITED 10 MINUTES AFTER THE SECOND PAGE BEFORE WE LEFT. AT LEAST 5 OTHER FOLKS AFTER US WERE STILL WAITING FOR AS WE WERE LEAVING. WON'T BE BACK EXCEPT TO RETURN THE PIECE WE WERE TRYING TO EXCHANGE. I'LL STICK WITH LOWE'S FROM NOW ON! COULD HAVE DRIVEN THERE IN THE TIME WE WASTED WAITING HERE!!!!

text: I visited the Paint Spot to get advice on painting my office. The staff was incredibly knowledgeable and helpful. I don't normally review things, but I was very satisfied with my service here. The staff was able to make great recommendations based off the photos I came prepared with (paint on my ceiling was cracking and my walls needed to be re-textured in some spots). After a short discussion we ascertained the type of paint I needed (latex vs. oil). The whole transaction took no more than 10 min and I walked out with everything I needed. Great prices. Great people. I would recommend to the Paint Spot to anyone. I am glad I came here!

text:
Hands down the best and most helpful hardware store on the Eastern Shore. The folks there are actually so helpful I drive there pretty much every weekend from Mobile for something.

It’s refreshing to have a place you can go where folks take time to actually help you. My go 2 guy there is Ridge. I have never had a single project he did not direct me in the right direction and tried to find the most cost effective option.

I give these guys my highest recommendation
5 ⭐️ Plus

name: Larry Barnette
text:
I'm in there a LOT. Their fastener section is better than the big chain stores.
The only complaint I have is the guy at the register that asked me why I was wearing a mask, and I told him that I was in heart failure (I should have told him to mind his damn business) he then told me me that he had TWO heart transplants and his cardiologist told him NOT to wear a mask, as if to belittle me.
I'm not calling him a liar, but my Cardiologist sure wants to meet his doctor.

name: Jack Minto
text: Stopped by Home Hardware in Daphne Sat but they were closed and walking out of the door to go home.   I started to leave but Amanda stopped me and asked what I was needing.  I told her and she said she would help me.  What a great experience I had there and I thank them for going above and beyond.  We are lucky to have them in Daphne.

resp.text: We're so glad to help you out, Jack!  We're happy to be in Daphne!

name: Derrick Crane
text: The hours on Google state they are open at 7 am on Saturdays.  At 7:06 the lights were off and the parking lot was empty.  They've been open before at 7 am as I've been there.  Come 11 am I called and couldn't get anyone to answer a phone.   A friend of mines business had a delivery scheduled from them today as well, and nobody showed up.  I like dealing with small locally owned businesses, but the big box store got the money today simply for being open during their stated hours.  This place seems to have gone downhill since changing ownership.

resp.text: Hi Derrick, thank you for sharing your experience.  We've shared them with the senior managers to review.  If you would like someone to reach out directly, please feel free to fill out a form on our website: https://www.homehardwarecenter.com/Contact-Us

Visited this location because I was in a hurry to find some pvc parts and it was on my way home. I wasn’t greeted at the door, and couldn’t find anyone to help me. It looked like it had a nice variety and good prices, but the customer service was lacking.

Visited for a second time after the managers wrote me on Facebook apologizing for my experience. Sadly, the same thing happened when I went in.

name: Daniel Bostick
text: The most awful unfriendly downright wretched place I have ever attempted to do business with..  I even went back and tried 3 times thinking the first two may have just been bad days for the beyond homely slightly female in some characteristics, although too difficult to say for sure whether it was a man, woman, or some evil physical manifestation of a succubus.  I can not understand for the life of me how they are still in business.  Must be a sham front store for something else or they have too my foolish pride to consider closing the doors even if it would be step one by any professional who reviewed their service standards for 15 seconds.   Oh and the prices are Beyond ridiculous!  Do yourself a favor and keep driving for 10 minutes until you hit home depot and lowes.  Only in this case would i recommend those big box stores over something local, but this case is far beyond extreme!

name: Caleb Hennon
text: I love this Sherwin Williams location. One time there was a fairly large mistake on an order of mine that happened and they immediately fixed the issue and kept apologizing for it. Before that, the staff was always very friendly and helpful. After that incident, though, the staff have become even more friendly and now remember my name and the company I work for so making and picking up orders is a breeze. They also seem to have a positive work environment because they always seem to be having some fun conversation with each other as I walk in about things like movies, their plans for the weekend, or other things like that. This never distracts them from helping me, though, and I am grateful for the employees here. They've helped me several times.

text: April was incredibly nice and helpful. She worked with my mom for almost an hour to find the perfect paint shade for my baby nursery. I don’t live in Montgomery so I went to a SW in my city to buy the paint that April had helped us pick.  Unfortunately, that SW computer system had the formula wrong and my paint looked totally different.  We called April and she was able to give us the formula over the phone so I could get the paint at a different store.  For someone who wasn’t even making a sale, she was more than helpful and patient and went above and beyond for us.

resp.text: We appreciate your review and apologize for this situation. We would like to better understand the product issue you're experiencing. We encourage you to first call or visit the store where the product was purchased. If you have any additional questions or would like to discuss your concerns with us directly, please give us a call at 1-800-4Sherwin (474-3794) or email us at https://www.sherwin-williams.com/homeowners/contact-us/feedback. Thank you. Sincerely, T.H., SW Customer Service Rep.

name: Michael Gosnell
text: I generally never go here because of the prices.  It had been a long time since I used their paint but I had a client who wanted it.  Staff was friendly and store was cleaned and we'll stocked.  However, it cost $630 for 10 gallons of paint!  Holy cow!  Same amount of paint at Home Depot for Behr Premium would have been $232.  Paint was fine but I actually prefer the quality of the cheaper paint.  They did carry the paint out to my truck with a dolly but I could have hired two people for the day to help me ALL day for the price difference.

resp.text:
Hi Michael, Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We're sorry you feel our pricing is not in line with the industry. As a corporation, Sherwin-Williams has made great strides to control costs on everything from raw materials to office supplies in order to stay priced competitively. We have increased prices only as a last resort and in most cases, after our competitors have already done so. We do offer many sales and promotions throughout the year. In addition, if you sign up for our PaintPerks program you will receive a $10 off of $50 coupon, everyday discounts on paints, stains and supplies and exclusive sales and emails. For more information on this program, please visit www.mysw.com. We thank you for sharing this feedback with us. If you have any additional questions, please give us a call at 1-800-4Sherwin (474-3794) or email us at https://www.sherwin-williams.com/homeowners/contact-us/feedback.
Thank you. Sincerely, T.H., SW Customer Service Rep.

name: Deirdre Taylor
text: I only go to home Depot if Lowe's doesn't have what I need, and that's rare. I always have a problem picking up orders. You can't just call in to have it brought to you by curbside because they claim to be too busy to get your information. When you go in, if the order is not in that little closet behind them, they'll just tell you it's not there rather than to go to the back and get it. I order a lot and never have a problem with Lowe's. It took an act of congress to finally get my complete order from Home Depot. One young lady, Kia went out of her way to help me and it wasn't even her department. Thanks to her I have everything. I only shop here when I absolutely have no choice.

name: Silvery Nova
text: The first problem is the delivery service company that Home Depot uses for direct deliveries,Central Transport. My 1st initial delivery date changed three time before it was actually attempted to be delivered on March 3rd. On March 3rd the shipment came on a long bed truck with a pallet dolly. My shipment is a pallet of 33 boxes of porcelain tile., plus 7 additional boxes they put on the same pallet. The right side of the pallet was coming apart due to the immense weight of the tile . The driver could not move the pallet down the truck. He was not going to be able to pull it up the small slope on my driveway. What on earth were they even thinking?They needed a fork lift. I called Home Depot and they got the Transport company on the line while I was on hold. I ended up being told the transport company needed to take care of this and they would contact me in 24 to 48 hours. Which they never did. I had to call them. On 3/5 Friday I called central transport and they told me the shipment would be delivered on Monday between 11 and 12. They never showed. I checked the shipment tracking and found that they changed it to Tuesday 3/9! I got no call, text, or phone call.So Tuesday 3/9 I message them to find out eta. They said the drivers hadn't left yet and to keep checking they will update me. That never happened. So I wait and wait and I get a call from Home Depot letting me know the tile has arrived at THE STORE. I was never told anything about this.They will be delivering the tile on Monday 3/15....

text:
I went in the garden center and told girl at registry, that  I wanted 2 medium bags of Miracle-Gro potting soil, and help getting it n putting it in car.  No help came, then she told me go in back pick it up.  Finally realized she charged me for garden soil, I ask her to give me potting soil and charge me for the difference.  She said she couldn't, I had go customer service.  I told her I wasn't able, that why I parked out in front garden center and ask for help.  I told her I would eat the loss and never come there again.

I don't like be hard get long with, but it was her mistake, why should I have go customer service, when I have trouble walking that distance.  I will use Lowes from now on.

I'm a 100% Service Connected Disable Veteran.

text: The lady who sold us a washer and dryer was very nice no problems at all. I have a problem with the fact that they were supposed to be delivered at my house on April 21st. It got delayed so they moved the delivery date to Today ( April 24th ) but I never got any notification so I called and they told me that they don’t deliver to my area on saturdays, only Wednesdays and they don’t deliver when the weather is rainy. It’s been SUNNY all day. No bad weather AT ALL. Now the delivery date has been moved to May 12th. I will be giving birth in May so that’s really annoying 🙄 I ordered my washer and dryer on MARCH 3RD!!!  I hope the warehouse manager makes this right.

name: Jessie
text: Went to buy an appliance that I saw online. Called the this particular store literally on my way over there. Young lady told me that indeed they had the sale item which I was inquiring about. I get to the store and spoke with someone worker in appliances I ask him again to verify of what I wanted. He walks back and confirms my injury. Rung me up just to realize he mentioned through conversation of the appliance he thought I was asking of. Which I corrected him and pointed out and literally touched again the same appliances that I wanted. Apparently some way some how after all this confusion. They magically had sold out. So my thinking leads me to believe the person I spoke to on the phone didn't bother to check or maybe something with system either way wasted my time and here's the kicker the way the guy tried to put it was like I could go to another home depot after I already paid. Luckily my bank released this debit transaction. Poor poor salesmanship and somewhere along the line communication is lacking. I hope I can revisit this location in the future without this issue.

I actually purchased a pressure washer could not get it to work they sent it off come back and said there was nothing wrong with it I said let's go to the garden center let's hook it up to hose and let's find out ..so finally they agreed after I insisted guess what it didn't work they still wanted $35. name: Robyn Curry
text:
**EDIT**
Since the freezer mishap below the management staff (namely Dave) has gone above and beyond to make things right by me. I feel like The Home Depot has redeemed themselves and they have earned my business once again.

I ordered an upright freezer to be delivered to my home. I missed three days of work for no-show deliveries and countless hours on the phone trying to get a freezer delivered and all I got in return was excuses and finger pointing. I had three managers from the West Mobile location involved in this situation (Dave, Cameron, and Jonathan) as well as the customer service help line. They were all aware of the fiasco that had occurred with this delivery yet when I asked what could be done no solution was offered. After a month of no freezer from the Home Depot I cancelled the order and bought one from Lowe’s. I had it the very next day. The Home Depot was always my go-to home improvement store but in light of the lack of customer service in this particular situation I think I’ll reconsider that.

name: Shaun Steffensen
text:
If you order appliances from somewhere, do yourself a favor and not order from Home Depot. First, the people who are selling the appliances do not know much about them. I was told that for installation of my microwave, I needed an outlet in the wall that it was being installed on. Great. I'm good. WRONG!!! The outlet had to be above the microwave.... Something that would have been nice to know, but they could not communicate that properly.
Then, the delivery/installation people had no idea what they were doing. They were more of a delivery company, not an installation professional. They could not install my gas range. They damaged my microwave. So, really, they weren't even a good delivery company. Home Depot just subs out delivery to the cheapest company....and you can see the quality when your damaged items arrive!
And I pray for you if you have ANY problems with your delivery or installation!!!
Count on a couple of things: 1) You will spend hours on the phone getting to talk to the right person. Once you think that you have the right person, they will tell you they have to check on something and they will have to call you back. OR, the right person is "on lunch" and they will call you back. After giving them ample time for "lunch" (3 hours) when you call them back, you will be told that they were "off today" but they will return your call in the morning.
Basically, it's a game of ping-pong and it takes days to get simple questions answered because, obviously, no one who works there wants to actually do anything.
I can't believe I dropped over $7K in there and they can't even answer a simple question!!!!
Buyer beware!!! Shop at Lowe's!!!

name: Lacey Paquin
text: I ordered $1,600 worth of appliances on black Friday to furnish my investment property. I scheduled them to be delivered on Friday, 12/22, and I was told the delivery time frame would be from 2pm-6pm. I planned accordingly and the my appliances were never delivered! No CALL or anything. It took me 4 different phone calls to reach an actual person. The delivery people could not be reached. I waited at the property until 10pm. I went to the store the next day and spoke with the manager, and apparently I was the 3rd customer complaining of no delivery and no notification. The store could not reach the delivery service because they were closed, and would not re-open again until that Tuesday after Christmas. I was told they "might" start calling customers then to attempt to re-schedule deliveries. I found this to be completely unprofessional and unacceptable. I cancelled my order and was refunded my money. I am showing my rental Wednesday and it will be empty. Home Depot has hurt my business.

name: Manda McGuff
text: Unfortunately I had been shopping with lowes. It had been on more than occasions than not a terrible experience. I decided to try Home Depot in my recent purchase of a bathtub. Within the first 5 minutes of being inside the store I was greeted by 4 associates. All of which were very welcoming and friendly none of which I have ever experienced at lowes. They pointed me in the direction I needed to go. Upon my arrival of the bath tub isles another associate was there eager and ready to assist me. He opened the merchandise and checked for defects and everything to my satisfaction. None of which I have ever experienced at lowes. Even on the way to check out associates asked if there was anything more they could do to help. Overall my experience at Home Depot was outstanding. I work in customer service and a lot of places lack in that department. Job well done!

resp.text: Hi Andrew, Thank you for sharing the details of your recent experience with us and we truly apologize for the lack of customer service you received at our store. Extensive training is administered to all staff, who we hold to a very high standard. We'd like to discuss the situation with you and put you in touch with the appropriate Sherwin-Williams contact who can assist.  Please contact us at 1-800-4Sherwin (474-3794) or by email at bit.ly/2Dgu0Ti. Please include your store location, if applicable, when reaching out. Thank you and again we apologize for this situation. Sincerely, T.H., SW Customer Service Rep.

name: Colette H
text: I have been coming to this store for my painting needs for the past 5 years. I had the DISpleasure with an associate there today named Christina. I am still recovering/reconstructing my home after hurricane sally. I had bought a gallon of paint back in January that had leaked from the bottom all over my garage floor. I am just getting around to returning to the store to exchange it. Christina not only told me the associate selling me the paint in January sold me the wrong kind but then proceeded to argue with me and not give credit on the exchange. I’m told leaking cans happen (of which the other associate offered) but this apparently very unhappy (never smiled, devoid of social skills) person, Christina, would not credit a longtime customer for a faulty can of paint. I will not ever buy anything from this store (or Sherwin Williams) ever again. #onelesscustomer #sherwinwilliamspaint #nocustomerserviceskills #swpaint
